page.title: 17IN THE HOUSE,KIRKCOWAN 1925
page.content: There was{no running water}but some families had a pump beside the sink in the kitchen.Others had their{pump} outside,sometimes in the{wash house.} For Saturday bath time water was brought from the boiler into a bath in front of the{range.}For Monday{washday water was heated in the boiler and the clothes were scrubbed{on a wash board. Because there was{no electricity}the houses were lit by{paraffin lamps} which had to be cleaned,filled and wicks trimmed ready for the next day. By their light rag rugs were made on hessian sacks.When going to bed,people carried a candle in a holder.In the kitchen there was a range on which they baked and cooked.There was a{swee where a pot or girdle hung above the range.The{toilet} was a bucket covered by a seat in a hut in the garden.
